p: Litsea cubeba oil inhalation showed a sedative effect. Garlic increased the alpha wave power at a low dilution. Higher dilutions also showed a sedative effect. The frontal and temporal regions of the brain were responsible for the response to Litsea cubeba oil inhalation. The temporal, parietal, and occipital regions of the brain were altered during higher dilutions of garlic oil inhalation. Litsea cubeba and Curcuma longa oil showed better positive mood scores, while garlic oil showed more negative mood scores.
